ddiff 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Literature Review
    • A Quick Start Guide to R Package ‘ddiff’

    obtain and compare custom univariate summary statistics from given two datasets

    ddiff_info_univariate.Rd

    This function could obtain and compare statistical information from given two datasets.

    ddiff_info_univariate(
  dat1,
  dat2,
  key,
  measure_arg_con = list(min = min, max = max, med = median, mean = mean, std =
    "standard error"),
  measure_arg_cat = list(table = table),
  measure_arg_bin = list(table = table),
  dis_arg = list("euclidean", "manhattan", "gower"),
  ...
)

    Arguments

    dat1

    First Data need to be compared.

    dat2

    Second Data need to be compared.

    key

    Unique identifiers to link two datasets

    measure_arg_con

    list of function for summary statistics of continuous response. The defalut list is c("min", "max", "median", "mean", "standard error")

    measure_arg_cat

    list of function for summary statistics of categorical response

    measure_arg_bin

    list of function for summary statistics of binary response

    dis_arg

    list of distance for measuring the difference of variables in each datasets

    ...

    potential argument to added

    Value

    TBC

    Examples

    d <- test_data()
ddiff_rpt <- ddiff_info_univariate(d$identical$new, d$identical$old, c("ID", "Days"))
ddiff_rpt
#> $result_con
#>              stat    variable         data1         data2
#> 1             min        Days  1.000000e+00  1.000000e+00
#> 2             min          ID  1.000000e+00  1.000000e+00
